results.title: Children of the Sun
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which tells of the fun, pleasures and growing-up of a happy child. Also portrays the story of the unhappy child and stresses the need of U.N.I.C.E.F.’s assistance in providing health and happiness.

results.title: Children of the mountains
results.creator_credit: Otto Ritter, Heinrich Fueter and Condor Films
results.brief_description: The children of the mountain-dwellers of Switzerland must learn to adapt themselves to the reality of their environment. They have their own task; the boys help their fathers, learning crafts for later life, the girls help their mothers inside the home, and trudging to the village on errands. Apart from school they enjoy skiing, playing a game like hockey, and riding on a sleigh.

results.title: The Children of the mist
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes some of the problems of adjustment that the Maori and Polynesian islanders have, as they try to integrate into the European society of New Zealand, but still retain their tribal identity.

results.title: The Children of the city
results.creator_credit: Budge Cooper, Paul Rotha and Paul Rotha Productions
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how the Scottish Courts, under a recent Act of Parliament, treat the problems of juvenile delinquency, through the work of probation officers, child guidance clinics, and approved schools.

results.title: Children of Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film is designed to enable pupils to make a direct comparison with their own way of life, in order to help them towards a better understanding of the influence of environment on a people’s way of life. The children of a typical Swiss mountain farming family are introduced at work and at play. Directly recorded conversations in the Swiss language are featured in the film.

results.title: Children of Scotland
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A survey of life in a Scottish fishing village on the Firth of Forth, showing through the eyes of children, the work of the fishermen. Pictures the children in their homes, and on a visit to a large fish market and to a shipbuilding town on the coast. Includes scenes of the ruins of a castle, recalling Scotland’s romantic past.

results.title: Children of revolution
results.brief_description: Presents impressions of youth in Czechoslovakia: the life of those born since 1948, with scenes of children in day nurseries and schools, and in more detail the daily life, employment and recreation of young workers. Discusses their behaviour and attitudes and shows that although most public activities are officially controlled, there is much personal independence, indifference to politics and interest in Western popular music and fashions. This is contrasted with the former popular support of the regime and identification with it expressed in the moribund Volunteer Youth Brigades. Written and narrated by Robert Kee.

results.title: Children of Germany: in the Rhineland
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Four boys are shown on a day’s excursion in the Rhineland. As they sail with a pilot of a barge from Kaub to St Goar, navigation and the Rhine’s industrial importance are explained. The boys climb the Spitzenstein and see vineyards, potato patches, castles and historical villages of the Rhine.

results.title: Children of China
results.brief_description: In this film, the home and community customs, the school training, and the family relationships which concern children in a remote and primitive Chinese village before World War 2, are studied.
